info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL CIBOLA, NORTHWESTERN SOCORRO AND NORTHEASTERN CATRON COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 447 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles south of Acoma Pueblo, or 29 miles north of Datil, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alamo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
